discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
30 Minutes wait-hold time is correct in this context.

Answer C

Automatic Fallback
Automatic fallback takes place when the server monitors the services and the Server Recovery Manager(SRM) service will automatically fallback users to their homed nodes. The key in this configuration is that the Server Recovery Manager(SRM) service will wait 30 minutes for a failed service/server to remain active before an automatic fallback is initiated. Once this 30 minute up time is established, user sessions are moved back to their homed nodes. The Jabber client will apply the re-log in upper and lower limits for the fallback. 

Automatic fallback is not the default configuration, but it can be enabled. To enable automatic fallback, change the Enable Automatic Fallback parameter in the Server Recovery Manager Service Parameters to value True.

questions.question_text: When Cisco IM and Presence is configured to use automatic fallback, how long does the Server Recovery Manager service wait for a failed service/server to remain active before an automatic fallback is initiated?
Which two protocols does the Cisco IM Presence service use to federate with external domains? (Choose two.)
When Cisco Unified Attendant Console Advanced is integrated with Cisco UCM, which Cisco UCM Service does the Cisco TSP Instance communicate with directly?

choices.B: Go to "Presence User Assignment" on the Cisco UCM Administration page and select "rebalance users" for all users.
choices.D: Start all critical services on both nodes and select "rebalance users" in the "Presence User Assignment".
choices.C: Start all critical services on the second node, and select the Fallback button in the "Presence Redundancy Group Configuration".
choices.A: Go to "Presence Redundancy Group Configuration" on the Cisco UCM Administration page and select the Fallback button.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting an issue with high availability on the Cisco IM and Presence Service. Users have not reported any degradation in service. Which steps resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
Node 1 transitions to Failed Over state when either
of the following conditions occur:
• Critical services come back up due to a reboot
of node 1.
• The administrator starts critical services on node
1 while node 1 is in Failed Over with Critical
Services Not Running state.
When node 1 transitions to Failed Over state the
node is ready for the administrator to perform a
manual fallback to restore the nodes in the
presence redundancy group to Normal state.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/12_5_1_su2/cup0_b_config-and-admin-guide-1251su2.pdf

questions.question_text: An administrator added a group of new users to the organization. The administrator also just finished configuring the Cisco Unified IM and Presence Service with calendar integration for Microsoft Exchange. Which two actions must be taken to ensure that these new users are configured to log in to Cisco Jabber and receive calendar presence? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D

B. Perform full sync of the LDAP directory.

Explanation:

Performing a full synchronization of the LDAP directory ensures that the new users are correctly imported and synchronized with Cisco Unified Communications Manager (UCM) and the IM and Presence Service. Without this step, the new users might not appear in the system, and their settings won't be applied to Cisco Jabber.
D. Select the "include meeting information in presence" check box.

Explanation:

To enable calendar presence integration with Microsoft Exchange, the "include meeting information in presence" check box needs to be selected in the user's IM and Presence settings. This allows the user's calendar information to be displayed as part of their presence status in Cisco Jabber, reflecting their calendar events (such as whether they are in a meeting or available).

comments.content: After further reading A and D are the correct answers

choices.A: Select the "enable user for Cisco UCM IM and Presence" check box.
choices.E: Ensure that each user logs in to Jabber and selects "Microsoft Outlook” in the Calendar Integration section of the Jabber client settings.
choices.C: Add the feature group template to LDAP sync.
choices.D: Select the "include meeting information in presence" check box.
choices.B: Perform full sync of the LDAP directory.
